headline.print_headline: Diabetes Study Ends Early With a Surprising Result
headline.seo: Diabetes Study Ends Early With a Surprising Result
headline.main: Diabetes Study Ends Early With a Surprising Result

docs.abstract: Large federal study of whether diet and weight loss can prevent heart attacks and strokes in overweight and obese people with Type 2 diabetes has ended two years ahead of schedule because the intensive program was not effective.
docs.lead_paragraph: Diet and weight loss did not prevent heart attacks and strokes in overweight and obese people with Type 2 diabetes.
docs.snippet: Diet and weight loss did not prevent heart attacks and strokes in overweight and obese people with Type 2 diabetes.

headline.print_headline: Multivitamin Use Linked To Lowered Cancer Risk
headline.seo: Daily Multivitamin May Reduce Cancer Risk, Clinical Trial Finds
headline.main: Multivitamin Use Linked to Lowered Cancer Risk

docs.abstract: Journal of American Medical Association publishes results from a large clinical trial of nearly 15,000 older male doctors followed for more than a decade, finding that those taking a daily multivitamin experienced 8 percent fewer cancers than subjects taking dummy pills.

keywords.value: Journal of the American Medical Assn
keywords.name: organizations

docs.lead_paragraph: A large clinical trial of older male physicians followed for more than a decade found that those taking a daily multivitamin experienced 8 percent fewer cancers than the subjects taking dummy pills.
docs.snippet: A large clinical trial of older male physicians followed for more than a decade found that those taking a daily multivitamin experienced 8 percent fewer cancers than the subjects taking dummy pills.
